intro: Alsine cherlerioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandplant, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers. The plant is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its growth habit is prostrate, with stems that often root at the nodes, allowing it to spread across the ground. Alsine cherlerioides plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small insects and animals in its native range.
